settings.content:
d = Inner ring dimension
D = Outer ring dimension
B= Bearing width

settings.text: Elevating Performance: Explore CeramicSpeed's Deep Groove Ball Bearing Portfolio

settings.content:
The deep groove ball bearing (DGBB) stands as the most widespread bearing design globally and is undoubtedly a focal point in CeramicSpeed's product lineup. Recognizing the crucial importance of aiding customers in selecting the right application-specific product specifications, we've categorized our DGBB portfolio into three distinct product families: Insulate, Xtreme, and Corrotec.

Each of these product families is meticulously engineered to enhance performance under different conditions. The "Insulate" series prioritizes thermal isolation to minimize heat impact, the "Xtreme" series is tailored for extreme conditions where durability and robustness are paramount, and the "Corrotec" series is dedicated to resisting corrosion, ensuring long-term reliability.

Our organization of these product families empowers customers to navigate seamlessly and discover the optimal solution for their specific needs. Whether you operate in demanding industries like motorsports or seek reliable bearings for everyday applications, CeramicSpeed has a DGBB solution tailored for you.

Explore our portfolio and unlock the next level of bearing technology that brings optimal performance within reach.

settings.title: Insulate
settings.content:
Our Insulate products are designed for maximum durability in electrical machines

  • Ceramic balls create an insulation distance off the full ball diameter - your guarantee against current erosion
  • C3 clearance (C4 on request) allows for the normal thermal expansion of motor- / generator shafts
  • Non-friction rubber seals (Type RZ) protect against outside contamination without compromising low-friction running
  • Well proven wide temperature greases ensure long grease life and silent running

settings.title: Corrotec
settings.content:
The Corrotec product group is designed for maximum reliability in wet and otherwise challenging conditions in the food, pharma, and beverage industries.

  • Ceramic balls allow for long service life even when lubrication is challenged by water and other contaminants
  • Stainless steel rings allow survival in moist conditions
  • High-quality friction seals offer maximum protection against particle ingress
  • Material and lubricant combinations all live up to FDA / EN 1935 regulations for incidental food contact

settings.title: Xteme
settings.content:
CeramicSpeed Xtreme bearings are not optimized against one specific industry but offer an overall more robust solution to several industries. The benefits of combining high-quality steel rings with ceramic balls allow for:

  • Higher rotational speeds
  • Reduced lubrication or even dry running
  • Longer service life in oscillating or start-stop applications
  • Longer service life in contaminated environments
  • Longer service life under extreme temperatures

Why CeramicSpeed Full Ceramic Bearings?

In response to increased demand and after careful consideration, we've witnessed several cases where Full Ceramic Bearings have proven to be the superior choice in the most challenging conditions. This acknowledgement, coupled with our customers growing interest, has led us to expand our product offerings with these exceptional bearings.

Key Features:

CeramicSpeed Full Hybrid Ceramic Bearings are high quality ceramic bearings â€“ featuring Zirconium Dioxide (ZrO2) Bearing Rings for simplified design and ceramic balls made of Silicium Nitride for low friction and remarkable resistance.

Zirconium Dioxide (ZrO2) Bearing Rings: CeramicSpeed Full Hybrid Ceramic Bearings consist of Zirconium dioxide (ZrO2) bearing rings, which are an extremely tough ceramic material with heat expansion properties close to those of steel, simplifying the design of shaft- and housing fits.

Silicon Nitride Balls: our full hybrid ceramic hybrid bearings are fitted with superior Silicon Nitride balls, and boast the highest achievable surface finish and roundness. This combination of Zirconium rings and silicon nitride balls in ceramic bearings results in a bearing solution with a low friction coefficient, reduced mass, and remarkable resistance to water, chemicals, and other aggressive media. Moreover, the use of ceramic balls, such as Silicon Nitride, provides distinct advantages over traditional steel balls. Ceramic balls offer enhanced durability, corrosion resistance, and a lighter weight, contributing to overall improved performance and service life of the bearing system.

settings.title: What are the advantages of full ceramic bearings compared to traditional steel bearings?
settings.content: Full Ceramic bearings offer several advantages, including much higher temperature resistance, reduced friction, and greater corrosion resistance. They also have a longer lifespan and require less maintenance, making them ideal for demanding industrial applications

settings.title: How do full ceramic bearings affect the energy efficiency of machinery?
settings.content: Full ceramic bearings contribute to improved energy efficiency in machinery by reducing friction and heat generation. This leads to lower energy consumption and extends the lifespan of both the bearings and the machinery.

settings.title: Are full ceramic bearings suitable for use in aggressive environments?
settings.content:
Absolutely. Full ceramic bearings are ideal for use in aggressive environments due to their
excellent corrosion resistance. They can withstand harmful chemicals, saltwater, and extreme temperatures, making them perfect for demanding industries.

settings.title: What is the lifespan of ceramic bearings compared to steel bearings?
settings.content: Full ceramic bearings typically have a longer lifespan than traditional steel bearings. They are less prone to corrosion, and their ability to withstand high temperatures without deformation significantly extends their service life.
